description: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
- Inanimate objects (for insance breakable doors or mining rocks)
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsFunctions.description: Apply damage to the object. Shield and armor can reduce this damage if enabled.
eventsFunctions.name: Hit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Apply _PARAM2_ points of damage to _PARAM0_ (Damage can be reduced by Shield: _PARAM3_, Armor: _PARAM4_)

events.comment: Only consider incoming damage when damage cooldown is not active
No damage will be applied when dodged
If shield is active, damage the shield first
If damage is less than shield, subtract damage from shield.
If damage is greater than shield, conditionally apply excess damage based on property
Apply excess damage only if shield does not block excess damage

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Westboy31
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FlashTransitionPainter
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Behavior for shape painter allows you to paint a color all over the screen for period of time with an effect (useful for simulate flash and transition effect).
description: * __Paint effect:__ Action to paint a color all over the screen for a period of time with specific effect.
* __Flash:__ is a monochrome color appear with fade then disappear with fade out.
* __Vertical:__ is a monochrome color comes from right side then comes back.
* __Horizontal:__ is a monochrome color come from top side then comes back.
* __Circular:__ is a circle which increases from the center and narrows.
* __Paint effect ended:__ event when the paint effect ends.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Paint all over the screen a color for a period of time.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FlashTransitionPainter

events.comment: Ensure shape painter properties are set correctly for this extension to work.
from left to right
Smooth edges
from top to bottom
Smooth edges
A circle scale up from the middle.
Smooth edges

eventsFunctions.description: Paint Effect.
eventsFunctions.name: PaintEffect
eventsFunctions.sentence: Paint effect type _PARAM4_ of _PARAM0_ with direction _PARAM5_ and color _PARAM2_ for _PARAM3_ seconds

If user doesn't assign value to color and type , we take the last value registred.

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Create the label that is displayed over the thumb.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

parameters: max(Background.BoundingBoxRight(), max(Label.BoundingBoxRight(), Thumb.BoundingBoxRight())) - min(Background.BoundingBoxLeft(), min(Label.BoundingBoxLeft(), Thumb.BoundingBoxLeft()))
max(Background.BoundingBoxBottom(), max(Label.BoundingBoxBottom(), Thumb.BoundingBoxBottom())) - min(Background.BoundingBoxTop(), min(Label.BoundingBoxTop(), Thumb.BoundingBoxTop()))

events.comment: The parent size is not defined in onCreate so it needs to be done here.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PixelPerfectMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Grid-based or pixel perfect platformer and top-down movements.
description: Games with pixel art usually use pixels bigger than actual pixels of the screen. This can lead to big pixels partially overlapping each other which doesn't look good.
This extension allows to seamlessly keep big pixels aligned when the object is stopped and still beneficiate from the high resolution of the screen to have smooth movements.
* Align top-down characters on a grid ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-grid-movement))

eventsFunctions.description: Return the speed necessary to cover a distance according to the deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: SpeedToReach
eventsFunctions.sentence: Braking distance from an initial speed: _PARAM2_ and a deceleration: _PARAM3_ is less than _PARAM1_

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Seamlessly align big pixels using a top-down movement.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PixelPerfectTopDownMovement

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Seamlessly align big pixels using a platformer character movement.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PixelPerfectPlatformerCharacter

events.comment: We don't know if the deceleration was already applied or not this step, but if the speed drifted from more than 1%, another extension is probably modifying the speed and it must not be overridden.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.
Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.
Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.

Check if the character is decelerating.
It's done in doStepPostEvent because there is no way to know if the doStepPreEvents of this behavior is executed before or after the one of PlatformerCharcter.
As TimeDelta is used, we have to be sure the last PlatformerCharcter.doStepPreEvents call used the same TimeDelta. Which means this must be done after PlatformerCharcter.doStepPreEvents.
Save the speed to detect speed changes from outside.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AnimatedBackAndForthMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make the object go on the left, then when some distance is reached, flip and go back to the right. Make sure that your object has two animations called "GoLeft" and "TurnLeft".
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Make the object go on the left, then when some distance is reached, flip and go back to the right. **Make sure** that your object has **two animations called "GoLeft" and "TurnLeft"**.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Make the object go on the left, then when some distance is reached, flip and go back to the right. Make sure that your object has two animations called "GoLeft" and "TurnLeft".
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AnimatedBackAndForthMirroredMovement

events.comment: Move the object to the left or right
If the distance "DistanceX" is reached, turn the object
At the end of the turn, go back to moving to th left (or right if flipped)

propertyDescriptors.label: Speed on X axis, in pixels per second

propertyDescriptors.label: Distance traveled on X axis, in pixels
